descriptionHtml:
There are two versions, Regular and Basic. The Regular version has lots of armor sets and some clothing sets. The Basic version only has two sets of armor (Daedric and Dragonscale) and one clothing set.

Latest version for the Regular mod is 1.5.
Latest version for the Basic mod is 1.0.

Please do NOT use the Regular and the Basic mods together, bad things could happen! Choose only one.

Craft invisible armor at any forge and upgrade it at a workbench. Invisible clothes can be crafted at the tanning rack under "Misc". Clothing names begin with the word "sky's", i.e., "sky's Invisible Boots".

Armors and clothes are stand alone, which means none of the original Skyrim assets are affected.

Invisible helmets use the ear slot, so you can wear circlets with them.

If you don't want to craft the armor, then follow the steps below:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If you want to add a certain invisible armor piece, like a Daedric helmet or something, to your inventory without having to craft it, then open the console window by pressing the tilda key, looks like ~ and type:
help "Invisible Daedric" 4
You will get some codes related to the invisible armor. Now, type:
player.additem xxxxxxxx 1 (replace the x's with the code you just got for the armor you wanted; and the 1 in my example is the quantity, so I only wanted one item added to my inventory).
Press the Enter key. A message should appear at the top-left of your screen saying something about armor being added to your inventory.
Press the tilda key again to close the console window.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Note (for the Regular version only):
Daedric and Ebony Light Armor will work with all Light Armor perks except for Light Armor's Matching Set. However, if you get Heavy Armor's Matching Set perk, it will work with both the heavy and light armor versions of Daedric and Ebony.

Stormcloak Officer Armor is listed under Hide, and the remaining Stormcloak armor sets are listed under Leather. The Steel Smithing perk unlocks the ability to craft Stormcloak armor.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This mod will be updated as needed. Let me know if you find a bug so I can fix it. Special requests will be done as optional addons.

--------------------
INSTALLATION
--------------------
File is just an .esp, place it in Skyrim's Data folder. Or install using NMM. Choose either the Regular or the Basic version, not both.

If manually upgrading from an older version to a newer version, place the newer file into Skyrim's Data folder, and select yes when asked to overwrite the older file.

--------------------
UNINSTALL
--------------------
Remove the .esp file from Skyrim's Data folder, or deselect the check box in NMM or Data Files for this mod.

---------------------
REQUIREMENTS
---------------------
Skyrim.esm and Update.esm files patched to their latest versions
No DLCs required

---------------------
COMPATIBILITY
---------------------
This mod should be compatible with any body replacer mod. This mod has been tested using:
Original Skyrim bodies (aka vanilla)
Better Males Mod
CBBE
CHSBHC
SeveNBase
UNPB
*See screenshots in the images section

-------------------------
Future Plans
-------------------------
1. Invisible Guard Armor Optional file, special request by Blackomn0
-v1.0 released Dec 8, 2013
-This is an ARMOR REPLACER for guards. This mod will conflict with any other guards' armor replacer mod you have installed. This mod does not require any of my other Invisible Armor Crafted mods to be installed; but, it is compatible with them.
-Place this file at the bottom of your load order.

-------------------------
Change Log
-------------------------
Basic version:
11/25/2013 Basic v.1.0 - Added an optional main file for anyone wanting a basic version of this mod, it has two armor sets and one clothing set.

Regular Version:
11/25/2013 v1.5 - Bug fix for one of the clothes not appearing invisible.
11/24/2013 v1.4 - Bug fixes and added Stormcloak armor sets and more clothes.
11/19/2013 v1.3 - In the vanilla game, the player could craft two Imperial Armor Sets (Light and Heavy) when they had the Steel Smithing Perk. I forgot to make invisible armor sets for them, so here they are; and now this means every craftable Skyrim armor (from the original game) has an invisible counterpart.
11/19/2013 v1.2 - More bug fixes

-------------------------
Current Bugs/Issues
-------------------------
None that I am aware of.

Fixed Bugs
--------------------
-11/25/2013 - Bug fix for one of the clothes not appearing invisible. -v1.5
-11/24/2013 - Recipe and tempering bug fixes for a few items. -v1.4
-11/19/2013 - Not really a bug, but changed the invisible helmet so it now uses the ear slot. This allows the player to wear circlets. -added in v1.2
-11/19/2013 - Minor bug with the invisible version of Scale Gauntlet not being invisible, and showing up on Khajiit and Argonian races. Khajiit and Argonian would also have gaps in their wrists in first person view when equipping invisible versions of Steel Imperial Gauntlets, Hide Bracers, or Studded Bracer. - This bug was fixed in v1.2
-11/19/2013 - First Person View Problem: In first person view the wrists seem to disappear, so I'll have to do some research to figure out what's causing this. - This bug was fixed in v1.1

--------------------------
Special Thank You
--------------------------
I would like to thank all the modders who I've silently watched and learned from. Also, a very special thank you to Adinsx08 for his mod Addys Invisible Armor Set http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/7608/?, without him this mod would not exist. Thank you, Adinsx08!

1. Thank you Bethesda for creating the greatest game ever and releasing the Creation Kit, giving us the tools to mod Skyrim.
2. Thank you Nexus for having such a great site, and allowing anyone and everyone the opportunity to post and download mods for free.
3. And THANK YOU Nexus Community, modders, downloaders, visitors, and guests, for all the hard work you do and enthusiasm you have for gaming and modding. You guys are truly inspirational.

Permissions
---------------
I am always trying to improve this mod one way or another, but I don't think I can add any more at this point. I give permission to anyone who wants to change, alter, and upload their own version of this mod, or somehow incorporate it with their own mod. Happy Holidays and have a great New Years :)
author: PhoenixSky
